comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content:
From Wikipedia.  

Geraldine Farrar (February 28, 1882 – March 11, 1967) was a soprano opera singer and film actress. Her striking beauty, lyrical voice and glamorous stage presence earned her a fanatical following among young women nicknamed "Gerry-flappers".

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Date written is 4/29/13. The NYT the following day query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9502E2DA1F3AE633A... says that Geraldine Farrar, Frances Alda, and Mary Garden all left on the same boat , the Kaiser Wilhelm II, for Europe. This group of photos were probably taken on the boat.

comment.author: 32999340@N04
comment._content: The American opera singer Geraldine Farrar (1882-1967) was a lyric soprano with great vocal skills and dramatic flair. Often paired with tenor Enrico Caruso at New York City's Metropolitan Opera, her career was relatively short-lived because her voice had given out by 1920.
